paragraphs.text: I am flawed. I am inadequate. I am dangerous to my own self.
paragraphs.name: 7b8b

paragraphs.text: Like there is a way about a woman and her daughter, there is a way about a man and his son.
paragraphs.name: 0b0d

paragraphs.text: I am facing my own truth now. I hope I am not too late.
paragraphs.name: c41a

paragraphs.text: I worry that we are sick, afflicted by the same disease that led our fathers astray.
paragraphs.name: 6d20

9495a3fabc0a.title: This is a heart felt and true article.

paragraphs.text: This is a heart felt and true article. It hits upon the very thing that most men suffer from. The absent father son relationship. As you said sure moms try to fill the gap but deep inside of us we know something’s amiss.
We blame ourselves sometimes we learn to not love as deeply as we should because it opens us up to the…

900960c99f8b.title: I will give no advice, I will offer no comfort, but your words ring true to me.

paragraphs.text: I will give no advice, I will offer no comfort, but your words ring true to me. I would say your post tells me at least you have the sensibility, and maturity to recognize in yourself things that many of us tried for years to ignore, to our detriment. Yes, the pain and doubt will always be a part of you, but with your self recognition, a little help…
When Fathers Fail
paragraphs.name: a42e

paragraphs.text: When your natural example is a disaster, how long before your feet find their way off the cliff?

258d932ce3d.title: “I am flawed. I am inadequate. I am dangerous to my own self.

paragraphs.text: “I am flawed. I am inadequate. I am dangerous to my own self.
paragraphs.name: f3e2

paragraphs.text: I have seen shades of a monster in me. I have been the nightmare that wakes me on some nights.
paragraphs.name: 1b39

paragraphs.text: How can I be anyone’s comfort when I am the terror they run from, just veiled by a thin mask of perfunctory politeness?
paragraphs.name: 385d

content.subtitle: I have seen shades of a monster in me. I have been the nightmare that wakes me on some nights.

virtuals.subtitle: I have seen shades of a monster in me. I have been the nightmare that wakes me on some nights.

3becfa5b241b.title: This is so beautifully written 🙂 Just wanted to add that our destiny is ours and not our parents’.

paragraphs.text: This is so beautifully written 🙂 Just wanted to add that our destiny is ours and not our parents’. They are fortunate but flawed beings blessed with the ability to procreate. Although our character is severely influenced by our upbringing no doubt. However, over time it is our often our will and choices that determine how we end up. The determination to defy the odds and not fail. It’s possible!
paragraphs.name: d060

e1b2c76ba342.title: This could be my son’s story in 5–10 years.

paragraphs.text: This could be my son’s story in 5–10 years. I’ve always hoped that awareness of the deficit would encourage him to seek outside role models instead of footsteps that never served him in the first place.
paragraphs.name: e470

b517674e5368.title: I feel as if you have reached into the deepest most hidden parts of my heart and found the words…

paragraphs.text: I feel as if you have reached into the deepest most hidden parts of my heart and found the words about my father I never could quite say.
paragraphs.name: a95c

paragraphs.text: Thank you. Thank you.

paragraphs.text: Thank you for this.
paragraphs.name: 1dac

paragraphs.text: Brilliant piece. I am a woman who has loved her share for broken, fatherless men. What you have that many don’t is your voice, your words. Part of the pain of loving men who are deeply scarred is that so many of them are emotionally valid. and illiterate. Which makes connection and intimacy nearly impossible. This, of course, then makes it…
paragraphs.name: f0e7

ec244b35e85a.title: Oreoluwa, Im obviously never going to be a father.

paragraphs.text: Oreoluwa, Im obviously never going to be a father. But my 40 years on this planet has been missing the father component. Yes, it’s a huge hole. I don’t know if it can ever be filled.
paragraphs.name: 4ed7

paragraphs.text: My grandfather died a month before I was born. My mother and I nearly died in child birth. My father was around for the first 8 years. He’s…

paragraphs.text: No no. I disagree here. To the world, they see me and my mom and think it’s this super duper tight knit relationship. Talk about living a lie. I love my mother with every ounce of my being, we don’t have ‘that’ kind of relationship. Mom and dad are both at arms length due to the damage they’ve caused. Sadly, they both act as if they’ve done nothing.
paragraphs.name: c36a

content.subtitle: I still long for the deep connection with one or both of my parents, but have accepted the history.
